alert.note: Alert for Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 6:01PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Norton County through 630 PM CDT... At 601 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles east of Clayton, or 13 miles southwest of Norton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Norton County, including the following locations... Densmore and New Almelo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
